info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 30 at 3:03PM MDT until July 31 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible.
* WHERE...South Central Mountains.
* WHEN...Through late tonight.
* IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms will continue this afternoon. After a brief decrease in storm coverage during the early evening, high resolution models depict a disturbance increasing thunderstorm coverage during the late evening and overnight hours. A few of the stronger storms this afternoon will be capable of producing rain at rates near 2 inches per hour. Late tonight, the maximum rain rate may reach up to 1 inch per hour, which would be sufficient to produce flash flooding below recent burn scars and in other places where the ground is already saturated from recent rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

parameter.value: FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT
